body_html:
@EronWright @jhseu I'm sure I will get some flak for this but as the documentation is a bit lacking...

I am trying to use SavedModel like so:

SavedModelBundle.load("/path/to/directory");

but am getting an UnsatisfiedLinkError. My directory contains the following files which were saved using the saver.save python API:

Am I using SavedModel incorrectly? I will add some documentation after I figure out what the issue is here! Thanks in advance.
body:
@EronWright @jhseu I'm sure I will get some flak for this but as the documentation is a bit lacking...

I am trying to use `SavedModel` like so:

`SavedModelBundle.load("/path/to/directory");`

but am getting an `UnsatisfiedLinkError`. My directory contains the following files which were saved using the `saver.save` python API: ![directory](https://puu.sh/uC4fq/ad18591acb.png)

Am I using `SavedModel` incorrectly? I will add some documentation after I figure out what the issue is here! Thanks in advance.
